lead_paragraph: The right-hander Liván Hernández agreed to a one-year, $5 million contract with the Minnesota Twins on Tuesday. The deal could earn him an additional $2 million in performance bonuses.Hernández, who has never pitched in the American League, made $7 million last season with Arizona, going 11-11 with a 4.93 earned run average in 33 starts. He has played for Florida, San Francisco, Montreal, Washington and Arizona since his major league debut in September 1996.
